newsitem.title: INDIA: Canada says to back India's APEC membership bid.
newsitem.headline: Canada says to back India's APEC membership bid.

text.p: Canada, set to chair a summit of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum later this year, supports India's bid for full membership, Foreign Minister Lloyd Axworthy said on Friday.
"Its (India's) participation in APEC would be absolutely instrumental in making that organisation effective," Axworthy told an international business conference in Calcutta.

APEC includes 18 countries from Asia, North America and South America which hope to achieve free regional trade by 2020. India has been seeking membership in APEC, which currently has a moratorium on new members.
"We think India clearly is a major economic and political force in Asia and in fact throughout the world," Axworthy told the Confederation of Indian Industry's annual meeting.

He said the APEC summit, set for Vancouver in November, was expected to establish guidelines for the admission of new members, and Canada hoped that New Delhi's bid would be taken up under the new criteria.
"I can assure you it is very uppermost in our minds," Axworthy said, adding that he would discuss the matter with Indian Foreign Minister Inder Kumar Gujral during his visit to India.
